topic: Socio Religious Reform Movement, Organisations and Personalities

flashcards.back: 1887, Bombay. Founders: M.G. Ranade, Raghunath Rao
Unite progressive Indian thought on social issues
similar to Indian National Congress' role in politics. INC didn't want to include social reforms in deliberations, decided to form separate body (UPSC 2012)
Served as social reform wing of Indian National Congress, launched 'Pledge Movement' against child marriage
advocated for inter-caste marriages, opposed polygamy and kulinism (old men marrying young girls)
Shiva Narain Agnihotri, 1887, Lahore
Closely aligned with Brahmo Samaj in religious philosophy, advocated righteous living, emphasising moral behaviour and spiritual discipline
Opposed bribery, gambling, alcohol consumption, non-vegetarian food. Promoted non-violence and ethical living
Compiled in book Deva Shastra
Strong opposition to child marriage
1892, Madras. Founder: Viresalingam Pantulu
Social Purity Movement, Opposition to Devadasi system, Efforts to alleviate oppression of widows
Swami Vivekananda (Narendranath Dutta), 1897, Bengal (centres at Belur and Mayavati were focal points)
Ramakrishna Paramahansa (Gadadhar Chattopadhyay)
Rejuvenation of Hinduism through Vedanta and ancient texts. Opposed caste restrictions, oppression, superstitions.
Focused on uplifting women and restructuring education system.
Promoted renunciation and practical spirituality through Ramakrishna Math and Mission. Advocated service of humanity as devotion to God
Belur (near Calcutta)
Oneness of all religions: 'As many faiths, so many paths.' Service to mankind as service to God: 'Service of man is service of God'
Both operated as separate but complementary organisations - Monastic Focus
Gopal Krishna Gokhale, with support from M.G. Ranade, 1905, Bombay
Focused on famine relief and improving welfare of tribals, with strong emphasis on economic upliftment and employment for women.
Trained national missionaries to promote true interests of Indian people, using constitutional means and preparing selfless workers dedicated to India's cause
1911: Society began publication of Hitavada, a newspaper to project its views and efforts

flashcards.front: Servants of India after Gokhale's death?
flashcards.back: After Gokhale's death in 1915, Srinivasa Shastri took over as president, continuing society's work
1909, Pune. Founders: G.K. Devadhar and Ramabai Ranade (wife of M.G. Ranade)
Focused on educational advancements for women and betterment of widows' conditions.
Worked towards empowering women and improving their societal status
Monastery of Disinterested Work, 1910, Pune. Founder: Dhondo Keshav Karve
Established women's university in Pune, now part of Mumbai University. Emphasised importance of women's education and self-reliance
1911, Bombay. Founder: Narayan Malhar Joshi
Improved conditions for common masses through social welfare activities like schools, libraries, cooperative societies.
Supported legal aid, excursions for slums, medical relief, boys' clubs. Key role in founding All India Trade Union Congress in 1920
1914, Allahabad. Founder: Hridyanath Kunzru
Focused on enhancing status of suffering classes through social service and education
1917, Madras. Founder: Annie Besant
Worked towards upliftment of Indian women by organising annual conferences, such as All India Women's Conferences.
Advocated for women's rights and social reforms across India

mcq.question: When was Indian National Social Conference founded?
mcq.explanation: Indian National Social Conference founded in 1887, Bombay by M.G. Ranade and Raghunath Rao (UPSC 2012).

mcq.question: INSC was formed because?
options: INC didn't want to include social reforms in deliberations
mcq.explanation: INC didn't want to include social reforms in deliberations, so decided to form separate body for social issues (UPSC 2012).

mcq.question: INSC launched which movement?
mcq.explanation: INSC launched 'Pledge Movement' against child marriage, advocated inter-caste marriages, opposed polygamy.

mcq.question: Who founded Deva/Dev Samaj (1887)?
mcq.explanation: Shiva Narain Agnihotri founded Deva/Dev Samaj in 1887, Lahore.

mcq.question: Deva Samaj teachings compiled in?
mcq.explanation: Deva/Dev Samaj teachings were compiled in the book Deva Shastra.

mcq.question: Madras Hindu Association founded when?
mcq.explanation: Madras Hindu Association founded in 1892, Madras by Viresalingam Pantulu.

mcq.question: Who founded Ramakrishna Mission?
mcq.explanation: Swami Vivekananda (Narendranath Dutta) founded Ramakrishna Mission in 1897, Bengal.

mcq.question: Ramakrishna Mission guru?
mcq.explanation: Ramakrishna Paramahansa (Gadadhar Chattopadhyay) was the guru of Ramakrishna Mission.

mcq.question: Ramakrishna Mission headquarters?
mcq.explanation: Ramakrishna Mission headquarters at Belur (near Calcutta).

mcq.question: Ramakrishna Mission concept: 'As many faiths, so many paths'?
mcq.explanation: Ramakrishna Mission concept 'As many faiths, so many paths' represents Oneness of all religions.

mcq.question: Who founded Servants of India Society?
options: Gopal Krishna Gokhale (with M.G. Ranade support)
mcq.explanation: Gopal Krishna Gokhale founded Servants of India Society in 1905, Bombay, with support from M.G. Ranade.

mcq.question: Servants of India Society publication (1911)?
mcq.explanation: In 1911, Servants of India Society began publication of Hitavada.

mcq.question: Who took over Servants of India after Gokhale's death (1915)?
mcq.explanation: After Gokhale's death in 1915, Srinivasa Shastri took over as president.

mcq.question: Poona Seva Sadan founded when?
mcq.explanation: Poona Seva Sadan founded in 1909, Pune by G.K. Devadhar and Ramabai Ranade.

mcq.question: Ramabai Ranade was wife of?
mcq.explanation: Ramabai Ranade was wife of M.G. Ranade, co-founded Poona Seva Sadan.

mcq.question: Who founded Nishkam Karma Math (1910)?
mcq.explanation: Dhondo Keshav Karve founded Nishkam Karma Math (Monastery of Disinterested Work) in 1910, Pune.

mcq.question: Nishkam Karma Math established?
options: Women's university in Pune (now part of Mumbai University)
mcq.explanation: Nishkam Karma Math established women's university in Pune, now part of Mumbai University.

mcq.question: Social Service League founder (1911)?
mcq.explanation: Narayan Malhar Joshi founded Social Service League in 1911, Bombay.

mcq.question: Social Service League key role in founding (1920)?
mcq.explanation: Social Service League played key role in founding All India Trade Union Congress in 1920.

mcq.question: Who founded Indian Women's Association (1917)?
mcq.explanation: Annie Besant founded Indian Women's Association in 1917, Madras.
